Class Deck

java.lang.Object
Deck
public class Deck extends Object
Represents a deck of cards Contains an array of Card objects (cards) and an int value topCard to represent the topmost non-null value Implements Selection Sort and Merge Sort to properly sort the cards array
Author:
Rory McGuire

  • Field Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Field

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    Deck[]
    deal(int hands, int cardsPerHand)
    Deals a select number of cards to a select number of hands, removing each card from the cards array.
    boolean
    equals(Object o)
    Compares this Deck object with another Object to see if they are equal PRECONDITION: both decks only have one of each card
    Card[]
    getCards()
    Returns the cards field
    boolean
    hasCard(Card c)
    Finds out whether cards contains the Card object c or a Card that is equivalent to it
    void
    mergeSort()
    Sorts the cards array via mergesort with O(n*log(n)) efficiency Passes the cards array to helper methods in order to sort the array recursively
    Card
    pick()
    Picks a random card from cards, removes it from the deck, and returns the Card
    void
    remove(int x)
    Remove the Card at a given index, sliding the other Cards to the left to fill its place
    void
    selectionSort()
    Sorts the cards array via selection sort with O(n^2) efficiency
    void
    setCards(Card[] c)
    Sets the value of cards according to the value of c - will instantiate new values for each Card rather than using the same memory addresses
    void
    shuffle()
    Randomly shuffles the cards array, leaving empty indices at the back end of the array
    String
    toString()
    Returns a String representation of the cards array If the cards array is full with 52 Cards, will return the Cards in four columns, one for each rank Otherwise, will return a numbered list of each Card in cards, with each Card on its own line

    • hasCard

      public boolean hasCard(Card c)
      Finds out whether cards contains the Card object c or a Card that is equivalent to it
      Parameters:
      c - Card to be checked whether it is contained in cards
      Returns:
      whether c is in the cards array

    • deal

      public Deck[] deal(int hands, int cardsPerHand)
      Deals a select number of cards to a select number of hands, removing each card from the cards array. Will return nothing if there are not enough Card objects in cards, otherwise will return each hand of cards as its own Deck in an array of Decks
      Parameters:
      hands - the number of hands to be dealt
      cardsPerHand - the number of Cards to be dealt to each hand
      Returns:
      null if not enough cards to be dealt, otherwise an array of Decks, each Deck being a hand

    • pick

      public Card pick()
      Picks a random card from cards, removes it from the deck, and returns the Card
      Returns:
      the random Card to be picked from cards

    • remove

      public void remove(int x)
      Remove the Card at a given index, sliding the other Cards to the left to fill its place
      Parameters:
      x - the index in cards of the Card to be removed

    • selectionSort

      public void selectionSort()
      Sorts the cards array via selection sort with O(n^2) efficiency

    • mergeSort

      public void mergeSort()
      Sorts the cards array via mergesort with O(n*log(n)) efficiency Passes the cards array to helper methods in order to sort the array recursively

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a String representation of the cards array If the cards array is full with 52 Cards, will return the Cards in four columns, one for each rank Otherwise, will return a numbered list of each Card in cards, with each Card on its own line
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      the String representation of cards

    • getCards

      public Card[] getCards()
      Returns the cards field
      Returns:
      returns the Card array cards

    • setCards

      public void setCards(Card[] c)
      Sets the value of cards according to the value of c - will instantiate new values for each Card rather than using the same memory addresses
      Parameters:
      c - the Card array to be copied into cards
